item.content:encoded:
Ghibli Park

Visit Website

Ghibli Park, located in Nagakute, Aichi, Japan, opened its doors on November 1, 2022. The park is divided into five distinct themed areas, each inspired by a different Ghibli film and nestled within the grounds of Expo 2005. These areas include Ghibli’s Grand Warehouse, The Hill of Youth, Dondoko Forest, Mononoke Village, and Valley of Witches.

While tickets for Ghibli Park may be pricier than those for the Ghibli Museum, it’s recommended for those seeking a fully immersive experience. With its expansive grounds and a diverse range of indoor and outdoor attractions, visitors can deeply immerse themselves in the enchanting worlds of various Ghibli films.

With 14 scenes in interactive exhibits, you can immerse yourself in your favourite Ghibli scenes.

Ghibli’s Grand Warehouse

The primary section of Ghibli Park offers a diverse range of Ghibli-themed attractions. These include a screening room where exclusive short films are shown, multiple exhibition spaces, and a designated play area for children.

See Map

“Cat Bureau” from “The Cat Returns,” recreated in a cat-sized building

Hill of Youth

The initial area visitors encounter upon entering the park from the Linimo station is the Hill of Youth. It highlights the iconic elevator tower from “Laputa: Castle in the Sky” and “Howl’s Moving Castle,” as well as a house from “Whisper of the Heart.”

See Map

Dondoko Forest

Dondoko Forest, part of Ghibli Park, is highlighted by Satsuki and Mei’s house from “My Neighbor Totoro,” originally constructed for Expo 2005. The area underwent renovations in November 2021 and reopened alongside the rest of the park. Its name derives from the “Dondoko Odori” dance in the film.

See Map

Mononoke Village

Mononoke Village is dedicated to Princess Mononoke, reflecting settings like Irontown and Emishi Village from the film. The area displays models of the mystical creatures seen in the movie and feature a village settlement, a traditional charcoal burner’s hut, and an interactive area for visitors to engage with iron forge bellows.

See Map

Valley of Witches

The newly opened Valley of Witches, inspired by “Kiki’s Delivery Service” and “Howl’s Moving Castle,” features restaurants, small amusements, and replicas of Kiki’s home and Gütiokipänjä bakery. It includes a towering, life-size Howl’s Moving Castle with the iconic hat shop. Set to be the park’s largest area.

See Map

As well as Ghibli Museum, visitors must make advanced reservations for their specific entry date. Tickets cannot be bought at the park.

Get Tickets

Ghibli Museum

Visit Website

The Ghibli Museum is located in Inokashira Park in Tokyo. This museum features a theater screening scenes from films, a playful area for children, a rooftop garden, and exhibits related to their movies, including Spirited Away.
It is a major attraction, drawing in countless visitors, and tickets are in extremely high demand, making them limited in availability.

On the second floor, visitors can interact with one of the beloved characters from Studio Ghibli films: a large stuffed Catbus from “My Neighbor Totoro!” It’s a dream come true for many to have the chance to touch the Cat Bus.
*Only children aged 12 and under are allowed to enter and play inside.

Atop the museum, you’ll find a garden featuring a life-size, five-meter-tall statue of a robot from Castle in the Sky.

Planning to visit the Ghibli Museum? Remember, tickets sell out fast, so plan ahead. They sell out tickets in advance and no ticket is available to purchase at museum! You’ll need to check the museum’s official website for their opening calendar before deciding on your visit date.

Get Tickets

item.content:encoded:
What is the most popular Ghibli movie?

When I decided to start this blog, I was curious about the most popular Ghibli movie. I searched online for the popular Ghibli movie in Japan and North America. The difference in the results was interesting to me, so I’m sharing the results and my insights.

Ranking of Popular Ghibli Movies

  • Japan
  • North America
  1. Spirited Away
  2. Castle in the Sky
  3. Kiki’s Delivery Service
  4. Princess Mononoke
  5. My Neighbor Totoro
  6. Nausicaä of the Valley of the Wind
  7. Howl’s Moving Castle
  8. Porco Rosso
  9. Whisper of the Heart
  10. The Cat Returns

Reference
ジブリ映画一覧人気ランキング！歴代スタジオジブリ全作品でおすすめの名作は？. みんなのランキング. (n.d.-a). https://ranking.net/rankings/best-popular-ghibli-movies

  1. Spirited Away
  2. Princess Mononoke
  3. Howl’s Moving Castle
  4. My Neighbor Totoro
  5. Nausicaä of the Valley of the Wind
  6. Grave of the Fireflies
  7. Castle in the Sky
  8. Kiki’s Delivery Service
  9. The Red Turtle
  10. Ponyo

Reference
IMDb.com. (n.d.). Poll results: Favorite studio ghibli feature film. IMDb. https://www.imdb.com/poll/9gC66g0ShHM/results

Commonalities

Commonly popular Ghibli movies include Spirited Away, Princess Mononoke, Howl’s Moving Castle, My Neighbor Totoro, Nausicaä of the Valley of the Wind, Castle in the Sky, and Kiki’s Delivery Service.

Grave of the Fireflies

“Grave of the Fireflies” ranked 6th in IMDb’s poll, while in Japanese polls, it placed 19th. The film tells the story of two young siblings living through World War II, based on a true story, making it truly heartbreaking. Based on the poll results, I believe Japanese audiences view this movie more as an educational piece about wartime rather than just a piece of Studio Ghibli. I recall watching this film in elementary school, and it left a deep impact on me. Many reviews on IMDb label it as a ‘must-see,’ and I believe watching it can serve as a reminder to prevent future wars, despite its depressing nature.

Red Turtle

Another interesting point is that “Red Turtle” secured 9th place in IMDb’s poll, despite being relatively unknown in Japan. “Red Turtle” is an international co-production involving several French film companies and is unique in that it lacks any dialogue. The film premiered at the 69th Cannes Film Festival and received nominations, including one for Best Animated Feature at the 89th Academy Awards.
It’s the only Studio Ghibli movie without dialogue, and I’m genuinely intrigued to see what it’s like. I’ll definitely be giving it a watch soon!

Recommendation

On the other hand, “The Cat Returns” appears to be less well-known in North America. I highly recommend this film, especially for cat lovers. It’s lighter in tone compared to some other Ghibli movies, and the adorable cats will surely captivate cat lovers’ hearts. Since it’s connected to “Whisper of the Heart,” exploring those connections adds another way to enjoy this film.

Howl’s Moving Castle

ハウルの動く城

Watch Now
Watch Trailer

Sophie, a young milliner, is transformed into a 90-year-old woman by the Witch of the Waste and sets off to break the curse. She encounters Howl, a wizard, and his magical castle, where she makes a deal with the fire demon Calcifer. As war threatens the kingdom, Sophie learns of Howl’s secret and confronts the sorceress Suliman. With the help of her newfound friends, Sophie breaks the curse, restores Howl’s heart, and brings peace to the kingdom. The film ends with Sophie and Howl flying away in a new flying castle, embracing their love for each other amidst a world recovering from war.

Behind-the-scenes

Initially, Mamoru Hosoda, known for his work on films such as “The Boy and the Beast” and “Summer Wars,” was set to direct “Howl’s Moving Castle.” However, he ultimately stepped down from the project. Hosoda later reflected that his departure from “Howl’s Moving Castle” marked a significant turning point in his life, with the experience deeply influencing his subsequent work, notably in “The Girl Who Leapt Through Time.”

Ghibli food

When Howl returns home to the moving castle, he prepares breakfast, frying thick slices of bacon over Calcifer’s fire and cracking eggs onto them. The sight of Markl eagerly digging in looks truly appetizing.

Quote

Here’s Another Curse For You – May All Your Bacon Burn. —Calcifer

My Neighbor Totoro

となりのトトロ

Watch Now
Watch Trailer

University professor Tatsuo Kusakabe and his daughters Satsuki and Mei move into an old house near the hospital where their mother Yasuko is recovering from an illness. Mei encounters a spirit named Totoro in a camphor tree, but struggles to show him to her family. When Totoro appears to Satsuki and Mei during a rainstorm, they befriend him and he helps them grow a magical tree with seeds he gives them. Later, when Mei gets lost trying to visit their mother in the hospital, Totoro summons the Catbus to help Satsuki find her. The girls are reunited with their mother, who has recovered, and they leave a gift of corn for her before playing with other children, watched over by Totoro and his friends.

Behind-the-scenes

Due to being screened simultaneously with ‘Grave of the Fireflies,’ ‘My Neighbor Totoro’ incurred losses and became the lowest-grossing film in Studio Ghibli’s history.Despite the current popularity of ‘My Neighbor Totoro’,Due to being screened simultaneously with ‘Grave of the Fireflies,’ ‘My Neighbor Totoro’ incurred losses and became the lowest-grossing film in Studio Ghibli’s history.

Ghibli food

Satsuki is up early preparing lunch for herself, her sister Mei, and their father, as their mother is hospitalized due to illness. Despite being in elementary school, her efficiency in the kitchen are impressive.

Quote

Try laughing. Then whatever scares you will go away. — Tatsuo

Castle in the Sky

天空の城ラピュタ

Watch Now
Watch Trailer

In “Castle in the Sky,” Sheeta, an orphan girl with a magical crystal necklace, is pursued by both air pirates and government agents due to her royal heritage tied to the mythical floating city of Laputa. Rescued by Pazu, a young miner, they embark on a journey to find Laputa, facing perilous obstacles and betrayals along the way. As they reach Laputa, they encounter ancient technology and treachery orchestrated by Muska, who aims to harness Laputa’s power for his own destructive purposes. In a final showdown, Sheeta and Pazu unleash Laputa’s ultimate spell, causing its collapse and thwarting Muska’s plans, ultimately escaping with Dola’s air pirates as Laputa ascends into space.

Behind-the-scenes

The word “Balus” triggers a spell of destruction during the film’s climax. This magical word gained attention on Twitter in Japan during a television broadcast, setting a world record for tweets per second in 2013. The practice of posting “balus” online originated on internet chat boards in 2003 and has since migrated to Twitter. This phenomenon highlights the enduring popularity and influence of Hayao Miyazaki’s works in Japanese culture.

Ghibli food

While seeking refuge from Dola in a mine, Pazu offers Sheeta a simple piece of bread topped with a half-cooked fried egg. This scene, where the hungry duo eagerly devour their meal, is often described as “food porn” for its mouthwatering depiction.

Whisper of the Heart

耳をすませば

Watch Now
Watch Trailer

In “Whisper of the Heart,” 14-year-old Shizuku Tsukishima, an aspiring writer, discovers a connection with Seiji Amasawa through library books. Following a series of encounters, she befriends Seiji, who dreams of becoming a master luthier. Inspired by his determination, Shizuku dedicates herself to writing a fantasy story featuring a magical cat figurine known as the Baron. As she struggles with the pressures of school and her own insecurities, Shizuku finds solace in her creative pursuits. With encouragement from Seiji and her mentor Shirō Nishi, Shizuku completes her story and gains clarity about her future aspirations. Ultimately, Shizuku decides to pursue her writing and academic goals, while also accepting Seiji’s proposal for a future together, marking a journey of self-discovery and budding romance.

Behind-the-scenes

When Shizuku is looking for a book in the library, you can find a book titled “Totoro” on the book shelf.

Ghibli food

In the latter part of the story, Shizuku shares her first novel with Nishi, Seiji’s grandfather. Touched by her effort, Nishi serves her “nabe-yaki udon,” a hot pot dish consisting of thick udon noodles, vegetables, and other ingredients cooked in a savory broth.

Quote

Once you’ve found your gems, you have to polish them. It takes a lot of hard work. — Mr. Nishi

item.content:encoded:
The Cat Returns

猫の恩返し

Watch Now
Watch Trailer

High school student Haru rescues a cat that was about to be run over by a truck and discovers the cat is actually a prince named Lune. Out of gratitude, Lune’s father, the Cat King, asks her to marry Lune. Disturbed by the idea, she seeks help from the Cat Bureau, meeting the Baron and Muta, who guide her to the kingdom. There, Haru is treated like royalty but slowly starts transforming into a cat. With the Baron’s guidance, she realizes she must find her true self and rejects the King’s proposal. Learning that her rescuer, Yuki, guided her to the Cat Bureau, Haru gains confidence and escapes with the help of her newfound friends. Returning to the human world, she embraces her independence and newfound self-assurance.

Behind-the-scenes

Upon its release, the most notable aspect was the presence of familiar characters like the Baron and Muta, along with settings reminiscent of previous Ghibli films. Interestingly, “The Cat Returns” is rooted in a backstory where it is a tale written by Shizuku Tsukishima from “Whisper of the Heart.” Essentially, it marked Studio Ghibli’s first spin-off film, departing from their usual policy of avoiding sequels.

Ghibli food

The fish-shaped cookie that Haru gave to Yuki, who was a stray cat, becomes a key when Haru and Yuki reunite. This cookie is actually available for purchase at a cake shop in Koenji, Tokyo, which appeared in the film.

Quote

Always believe in yourself. Do this and no matter where you are, you will have nothing to fear. — Baron

item.content:encoded:
Kiki’s Delivery Service

魔女の宅急便

Watch Now
Watch Trailer

In “Kiki’s Delivery Service,” the young witch Kiki sets out on her own with her talking black cat, Jiji, and starts a delivery service in a new town. She faces challenges, including losing her flying ability and experiencing a crisis of confidence, but finds support from new friends like Osono and Ursula. When a dirigible accident puts her friend Tombo in danger, Kiki overcomes her struggles, regains her powers, and saves him. Through these experiences, Kiki discovers her true strength and finds happiness in her newfound independence and friendships.

Behind-the-scenes

In the Japanese version, Kiki and her supportive mentor and sisterly figure, the painter Ursula, are both voiced by Minami Takayama, who is also known for voicing the main character Conan in the anime “Detective Conan.

Ghibli food

Kiki received a delivery task from an elderly lady in her new town—a ‘herring and pumpkin pot pie’ for her granddaughter. She helps the lady by lighting a fire and baking the pie in an old oven, as the lady’s oven is broken and causing her distress.

Quotes

“It’s not really important what colour your dress is. What matters is the heart inside.”

item.content:encoded:
Spirited Away

千と千尋の神隠し

Watch now
Watch Trailer

“Spirited Away” follows the story of Chihiro, a young girl who unknowingly enters a fantastical realm inhabited by spirits and supernatural beings. After her parents are transformed into pigs by eating the food meant for these creatures, Chihiro must navigate a mysterious bathhouse run by the witch Yubaba to find a way to save them and return to the human world. Along the way, she encounters strange creatures, befriends a boy named Haku who harbors his own secrets, and learns valuable lessons about courage, compassion, and the power of self-discovery. As Chihiro matures and faces various challenges, she ultimately finds the strength within herself to overcome obstacles and break free from the enchantments of the spirit world, ultimately returning home with her family.

Behind-the-scenes

Director Hayao Miyazaki was deeply influenced by the existence of the Shimo-zuki Festival held in Nagano Prefecture, Japan. This festival, where hot water is offered to the gods during the winter solstice to purify and renew the soul, inspired the motif of gods visiting a bathhouse to heal their fatigue in this film.

Ghibli food

Haku gives Chihiro a rice ball to eat, which sustains her and represents his goodwill towards her. This simple act of generosity marks the beginning of their bond and sets the tone for Chihiro’s journey

Quote

“Once you’ve met someone, you never really forget them.”
